input_args.examples: {'document_id': ['0001007', '0001007', '0001013', '0001013'], 'document_source': ['GHR', 'GHR', 'GHR', 'GHR'], 'document_url': ['https://ghr.nlm.nih.gov/condition/ulcerative-colitis', 'https://ghr.nlm.nih.gov/condition/ulcerative-colitis', 'https://ghr.nlm.nih.gov/condition/van-der-woude-syndrome', 'https://ghr.nlm.nih.gov/condition/van-der-woude-syndrome'], 'category': [None, None, None, None], 'umls_cui': ['C0009324', 'C0009324', 'C1511780|C0175697', 'C1511780|C0175697'], 'umls_semantic_types': ['T047', 'T047', 'T019|T049|T047', 'T019|T049|T047'], 'umls_semantic_group': ['Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders'], 'synonyms': ['colitis gravis|idiopathic proctocolitis|inflammatory bowel disease, ulcerative colitis type|UC', 'colitis gravis|idiopathic proctocolitis|inflammatory bowel disease, ulcerative colitis type|UC', 'cleft lip and/or palate with mucous cysts of lower lip|lip-pit syndrome|VDWS|VWS', 'cleft lip and/or palate with mucous cysts of lower lip|lip-pit syndrome|VDWS|VWS'], 'question_id': ['0001007-4', '0001007-5', '0001013-1', '0001013-2'], 'question_focus': ['ulcerative colitis', 'ulcerative colitis', 'van der Woude syndrome', 'van der Woude syndrome'], 'question_type': ['inheritance', 'treatment', 'information', 'frequency'], 'question': ['Is ulcerative colitis inherited ?', 'What are the treatments for ulcerative colitis ?', 'What is (are) van der Woude syndrome ?', 'How many people are affected by van der Woude syndrome ?'], 'answer': ['The inheritance pattern of ulcerative colitis is unknown because many genetic and environmental factors are likely to be involved. Even though the inheritance pattern of this condition is unclear, having a family member with ulcerative colitis increases the risk of developing the condition.', "These resources address the diagnosis or management of ulcerative colitis:  - American Society of Colon and Rectal Surgeons  - Cedars-Sinai  - Crohn's & Colitis Foundation of America: Colitis Diagnosis and Testing  - Crohn's & Colitis Foundation of America: Colitis Treatment Options  - Genetic Testing Registry: Inflammatory bowel disease 1  - MedlinePlus Encyclopedia: Ulcerative Colitis   These resources from MedlinePlus offer information about the diagnosis and management of various health conditions:  - Diagnostic Tests  - Drug Therapy  - Surgery and Rehabilitation  - Genetic Counseling   - Palliative Care", 'Van der Woude syndrome is a condition that affects the development of the face. Many people with this disorder are born with a cleft lip, a cleft palate (an opening in the roof of the mouth), or both. Affected individuals usually have depressions (pits) near the center of the lower lip, which may appear moist due to the presence of salivary and mucous glands in the pits. Small mounds of tissue on the lower lip may also occur. In some cases, people with van der Woude syndrome have missing teeth.  People with van der Woude syndrome who have cleft lip and/or palate, like other individuals with these facial conditions, have an increased risk of delayed language development, learning disabilities, or other mild cognitive problems. The average IQ of individuals with van der Woude syndrome is not significantly different from that of the general population.', 'Van der Woude syndrome is believed to occur in 1 in 35,000 to 1 in 100,000 people, based on data from Europe and Asia. Van der Woude syndrome is the most common cause of cleft lip and palate resulting from variations in a single gene, and this condition accounts for approximately 1 in 50 such cases.']}
